column16: Description of Program
column18: Ave. # of hours of all digital programming per week
column19: Ave. # of hours per week of digital Core Programming per week
column20: Y or N to Q 11 in Digital Core Programming: At least 50% of the Core Programming had not already aired within the previous seven days

column16: Via a magical transformation, nine-year-old Leonard Helperman's dog "Spot" discovers that he is able to talk and walk upright. He seizes the opportunity to fulfill a lifelong ambition: to go to school. Dressed in some of Leonard's clothes, Spot becomes "Scott Leadready," reveling in the challenge of learning fourth-grade spelling, math and history. The fourth grade teacher, Mrs. Helperman, is Leonard's mother. She is a single parent. This series celebrates the privilege of being able to obtain an education. Stories teach honesty, cooperation, team work, resourcefulness, respect for rules (particularly in the school setting) and empathy. "Spot/Scott's" wide vocabulary exposes the audience to new vocabulary, used in context.

"Lloyd in Space" is the story of an alien boy who attends Middle School in a galaxy far away. His mother, Nora, is the commander of the space station in Intrepidville, where Lloyd, his six-year-old sister Francine and his three buddies, Eddie, Kurt and Douglas live. Nora is a single parent. Many of the stories are set at school and invlove peer and friendship issues as well as school rules, procedures and authority conflicts. Episodes are designed to teach values, problem-solving, responsibility (as in a story about Lloyd's babysitting his younger sister, who runs away when he becomes overbearing, and several stories about taking responsibility for pets), and goal setting.

"Disney's Recess" is a collection of stories about six fourth-grade children who attend public school. These children are an ethnically diverse and gender-diverse group. Their experiences at Third Street School deliver messages about problems common to middle childhood: conflicts with authority figures, school and family rules, issues of fairness, peer pressure and coping with disappointment. A number of episodes revolve around class bullies or conflicts with teachers' favored students. Series episodes provide opportunities for parent/child discussions about values.

"Disney's Recess" is a collection of stories about six fourth-grade children who attend public school. These children are an ethnically diverse and gender-diverse group. Their experiences at Third Street School deliver messages about problems common to middle childhood: conflicts with authority figures, school and family rules, issues of fairness, peer pressure and coping with disappointment. A number of episodes revolve around class bullies or conflicts with teachers' favored students. Series episodes provide opportunities for parent/child discussions about values.

"Lizzie McGuire" is the story of an ingenious twelve-year-old girl who attends an ethnically diverse middle school. Her best friends are Miranda, a feisty Hispanic girl, and a boy named Gordo. Lizzie has a gifted younger brother who is frequently the source of conflict. Their parents handle their children's crises with humor and affection. Stories are realistic, revolving around school issues, rules, peer pressure, the struggle to find a comfortable identify, trust, facing one's mistakes, and the emotional ups-and-downs of pre-adolescence. Particular strengths of this series are its believability and the creation of a live action series that features a strong, positive girl in the lead role.

"Lloyd in Space" is the story of an alien boy who attends Middle School in a galaxy far away. His mother, Nora, is the commander of the space station in Intrepidville, where Lloyd, his six-year-old sister Francine and his three buddies, Eddie, Kurt and Douglas live. Nora is a single parent. Many of the stories are set at school and invlove peer and friendship issues as well as school rules, procedures and authority conflicts. Episodes are designed to teach values, problem-solving, responsibility (as in a story about Lloyd's babysitting his younger sister, who runs away when he becomes overbearing, and several stories about taking responsibility for pets), and goal setting.

Twelve-year-old Sabrina Spellman, who is half witch and half mortal, is being raised in a non-traditional family consisting of her Uncle Quigley and two young aunts. Series episodes explore social and developmental issues such as peer pressure/competition, loyalty and friendship, responsibility, honesty, facing fears, speaking up for one's beliefs, etc. Family issues such as divorce, remarriage and household rules are also addressed.

Via a magical transformation, nine-year-old Leonard Helperman's dog "Spot" discovers that he is able to talk and walk upright. He seizes the opportunity to fulfill a lifelong ambition: to go to school. Dressed in some of Leonard's clothes, Spot becomes "Scott Leadready," reveling in the challenge of learning fourth-grade spelling, math and history. The fourth grade teacher, Mrs. Helperman, is Leonard's mother. She is a single parent. This series celebrates the privilege of being able to obtain an education. Stories teach honesty, cooperation, team work, resourcefulness, respect for rules (particularly in the school setting) and empathy. "Spot/Scott's" wide vocabulary exposes the audience to new vocabulary, used in context.

"Mary-Kate and Ashley in Action" features two well-known, real-life siblings in a fanciful scenario. They play actors performing roles in a weekly movie about two young special agents whose adventures take them all over the world. Their sister "team" relationship is one in which cooperation, logical deduction, inventiveness and humor triumph. Mary-Kate and Ashley's friendship with a fellow team member, Chinese-American sixteen-year-old Rod Choi, is a close one, as is their relationship with Hispanic team member Ivan Quintero. Ivan is extremely gifted at technical and mathematical matters; his electronic inventions are a great asset to the team. In addition to problem-solving strategies, each episode teaches children values such as honesty, perseverence, kindness and respect for differences. As girls engaged in active, adventurous stories Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen are particularly good role models for our school-aged audience.

The High School Sportshow is a half-hour news magazine program directed at teens between the ages of 13 to 16. The program features the pro-social, on and off the field activities of male and female student athletes, coaches, student mentors and student families. The show is focused around messages that encourage the following values: school completion, community service, cooperation, tolerance of differences, and healthful practices and athletics. These educational and informational messages are conveyed through real-life examples, interview, and commentary by the program’s host. The program shows teens overcoming various obstacles and challenges in order to achieve their goals, and being awarded for their accomplishments. The youthful viewer identifies with the program messages not only because they see their peers, but also because they see their community, their school, and possibly, their friends. The adult caregivers can also rally around a local show, there the tangible examples of positive messages can be pointed to within their town.

“NBA INSIDE STUFF,” IS A HALF-HOUR NEWS MAGAZINE ABOUT THE PLAYERS AND PROGRAMS OF THE NBA. THE SHOW FEATURES PLAYERS AND COACHES IN A VARIETY OF SHORT SEGMENTS THAT COMMUNICATE A POINT OF VIEW OR REVEAL NEW INFORMATION TO THE AUDIENCE. THE INFORMATION MIGHT BE ABOUT THE GAME OF BASKETBALL OR IT MIGHT SHOW ANOTHER SIDE OF THE PLAYERS’ LIVES. EVERY WEEK, THE AUDIENCE SEES EXAMPLES OF INDIVIDUAL PLAYERS AND THE NBA ORGANIZATION IN CIVIC ENDEAVORS. WHETHER IT’S SUPPORTING READING PROGRAMS, SCHOLARSHIPS, CAMPS, OR HEALTH AND FITNESS PROGRAMS, THE NBA AND ITS PLAYERS HAVE A PRESENCE. IN SOME SEGMENTS, SPECIFIC QUESTIONS FROM THE AUDIENCE ON TOPICS RANGING FROM DEVELOPING SPECIFIC ATHLETIC SKILLS TO DEALING WITH PERSONAL PROBLEMS ARE ANSWERED BY A PLAYER. CO-HOSTS AHMAD RASHAD AND SUMMER SANDERS MODERATE AND CONNECT THE DIFFERENT SEGMENTS OF THE SHOW. EVERY EPISODE OF NBA INSIDE STUFF OFFERS CONTENT STRESSING THE VALUE OF PRACTICE, HARD WORK, AND PROFESSIONALISM AS A WAY TO ACHIEVE ONE’S GOALS.

“JUST DEAL” TAKES THE PERSPECTIVE OF THREE CLOSE FRIENDS, A GIRL AND TWO BOYS, WHO HAVE A COMPLICATED BUT VERY STRONG BOND OF FRIENDSHIP. SET IN SUBURBAN SEATTLE, THESE THREE HAVE COMFORTABLE AND HAPPY LIVES, BUT THAT DOESN’T ABSENT THEM FROM ALL THE NORMAL ISSUES OF ADOLESCENCE. THEIR OVERARCHING CHALLENGES ARE DEFINING THEIR VALUES AND PURPOSE IN LIFE, AND LIKE MOST TEENS, THEY ARE SERIOUS ABOUT FIGURING IT ALL OUT. THEY AREN’T CONFUSED OR ALIENATED, JUST EARNEST AND SINCERE ABOUT DOING THE RIGHT THING BY OTHERS, WHILE DOING WHAT IS BEST FOR THEIR OWN DEVELOPMENT. THEY HAVE DIFFERENT FAMILY BACKGROUNDS WITH STRONG PARENTS WHO ALSO WEIGH IN ON THE ISSUES. WHEN THEY MIX IT UP WITH INPUT FROM A DIVERSE CIRCLE OF FRIENDS THIS THREESOME ALWAYS LEARNS THAT LIFE ISN’T SIMPLE, NO MATTER WHERE YOU COME FROM OR WHAT YOU HAVE. THERE IS NO SUBSTITUTE FOR HAVING TO JUST DEAL. *Both the primary and secondary time periods for Just Deal were unavailable due to sports programming the weekends of November 3/4 and December 1/2. Program was delayed one week in both instances and aired adjacent to other children's programming.

“SKATE” COMES FROM THE PERSPECTIVE OF A “CULTURE” BASED ON A SPORT. THE CENTRAL CHARACTER IS A TEEN WHO IS TRYING TO BREAK OUT OF ATHLETIC MEDIOCRITY AND BECOME AN EXPLOSIVE SKATER. YET, HE’S GOT OTHER OBLIGATIONS, LIKE SCHOOL, COLLEGE AND LONG TERM SECURITY, WHICH TOTALLY CONFLICT WITH EMBRACING THE SKATER’S LIFESTYLE OF BRAVADO AND RISK. BALANCING COMPETING GOALS IS THE UNDERLYING STRUGGLE OF OUR MAIN CHARACTER’S LIFE, WHICH IS SPIKED BY SPECIFIC SITUATIONS THAT TEST HIS MORAL FIBER AND HIS DECISION-MAKING ABILITY. THROUGH A STRONG RELATIONSHIP WITH HIS FATHER AND CLOSE FRIENDS, OUR KID LEARNS HOW TO ESTABLISH PRIORITIES, BECOME A PROFESSIONAL, AND DEVELOP A GOOD SENSE OF JUDGMENT ABOUT PEOPLE AND SITUATIONS. *Skate was pre-empted in its secondary time period on Sunday,October 7 due to live coverage of the outbreak of the war on Afghanistan. Program was rescheduled to the following weekend on October 14.

“CITY GUYS” ORIGINATES AT A DENSELY POPULATED, MULTI-ETHNIC, PUBLIC HIGH SCHOOL IN THE HEART OF MANHATTAN. THROUGH ITS CHARACTERS, THE SHOW DEMONSTRATES THAT WHAT WE SEE DOESN’T BEGIN TO TELL THE STORY ABOUT WHO PEOPLE REALLY ARE AND WHAT LIFE IS REALLY LIKE. TWO YOUNG MEN, WHO SEEM TO BE OPPOSITES IN ALL THE OBVIOUS WAYS--RACE, ECONOMIC BACKGROUND, CULTURE, CLOTHES AND MUSIC--, ARE THROWN INTO A FRIENDSHIP AND WORKING RELATIONSHIP BY THEIR WISE AND ACERBIC PRINCIPAL. THE BOYS ACTUALLY HAVE A LOT IN COMMON--THEY ARE BOTH BRIGHT, THEY WANT TO BE MORE THAN THE NEGATIVE IMAGES THEY SOMETIMES PROJECT, AND THEY HAVE NEVER BEEN MOTIVATED TO REALLY THINK, REFLECT, OR ACT BEYOND THE SUPERFICIAL. AS THEY DEAL WITH THE PRESSURES OF BIG CITY LIFE, THEY LEARN THAT GETTING BEYOND THE SUPERFICIAL AND SERIOUSLY DEALING WITH A DEEPER REALITY IS THE CRITICAL PATH TO ATTAINING SUCCESS. *City Guys was pre-empted in its primary time period on Sunday,October 7 due to live coverage of the outbreak of the war on Afghanistan. Program was rescheduled to the following weekend on Saturday, October 13.

“ALL ABOUT US” IS SET IN CHICAGO, AND FOLLOWS FOUR HIGH SCHOOL FRIENDS AS THEY DEFINE THEIR FRIENDSHIPS WITH EACH OTHER. THE EMPHASIS IS INWARD AS THE GIRLS LEARN FROM EACH OTHER, WHETHER THE POINT IS TO RESPECT A FAMILY’S RULES, OR TO LET YOUR PARENTS HELP YOU WHEN YOUR PRIDE MIGHT GET IN THE WAY. THESE GIRLS ARE AN INTERESTING GROUP—AN ATHLETE, A SOCIAL CRUSADER, A SINGER/COMPOSER, AND A RICH DIVA---BUT THEY ARE ALL SMART AND AMBITIOUS. THEY USE THEIR DIFFERENT TALENTS, PERSPECTIVES, AND FAMILY EXPERIENCES TO ILLUSTRATE ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES TO UNDERSTANDING AND SOLVING PROBLEMS. THE BASKETBALL PLAYER’S APPROACH TO A BIG LOSS TEACHES THE SINGER HOW TO OVERCOME HER STAGE FRIGHT. WHEN THE AFRICAN-AMERICAN GIRL AVIDLY WORKS ON THE BLACK STUDENTS’ FUND-RAISER, THE OTHERS UNDERSTAND RACIAL ISOLATION FOR THE FIRST TIME. THE GIRLS COME TO APPRECIATE THAT EVERY PERSON HAS UNIQUE GIFTS; IT IS THEIR DUTY AS FRIENDS TO MAKE SURE THEY SHARE THEIR GIFTS WITH EACH OTHER. *All About Us was pre-empted in its primary time period on Sunday,October 7 due to live coverage of the outbreak of the war on Afghanistan. Program was rescheduled to the following weekend on Saturday, October 13.

Jack Hanna spends time with nature's creatures across the continents and talks with people who are knowledgeable about each animal and habitat, teaching as he goes. Each episode of the series is designed to reveal to children the world around them in a way that presents positive role models and pro-social values within an environmentally responsible universe.

Propelled by his own wonderful imagination, Nini takes children on enchanting journeys in Oooberryland, encouraging friendship, learning, cooperation, investigative skills, critical thought, organizing knowledge, and a love of reading. Every episode concludes with a problem solved, a friendship strengthened, a giggle, and a laugh.

Agua Viva is an entertaining educational and musical program that tells the adventures of a brother and sister whose toys come to life in Agua Viva. It's a beautiful place where they not only have fun, but also have an opportunity to play, create and learn together with their friends who help them understand the importance of love, honesty, and friendship. As they confront daily problems, they develop good character and a positive attitude towards life.

The enchanting adventures of a set of triplets who embark on adventures, battle villains, and discover secrets held in great classics of literature and fairy tales. It teaches the value of friendship, consideration, social themes, and ecological themes found in such children's classics of literature.

Live-action, kid-hosted show with a variety of segments that foster cognitive and social development. Winner of seven international awards, Bizbirije encourages children to create new ideas while having fun engaging in art projects, magic tricks, songs, science experiments, and ideas to save the planet.

Nico is a series designed to make children think about the rehabilitation and integration of disabled people in modern society, combining such messages with the adventure that each episode presents. From historical backgrounds to scientific and medical facts, the world of the blind is told in an entertaining, lighthearted way that all children can relate to and teaches children that blind kids are just like any other kid.

Toonimals is a series about animals seen through the amused eyes of animals themselves. Ollie the wise owl and his friends will show you some of the most unusual and least known phenomena of the animal world in a style that is original, modern, colorful, and self-assured. Strange facts, anecdotes, records, events, stories – it's the definitive study of animals in a wildly amusing series.

Juana la Iguana is a series of entertainment, educational and musical programs that tell the adventures of a group of children with an iguana named Juana. With the wink of an eye, Juana transports the children to her house, a fantastic place where everything is possible and from there they travel around the world. In their trips, Juana transmits to the children values such as friendship, teamwork, and the importance of non-violent conflict resolution.

Dragon Tales is designed to increase children's collection of strategies to deal with the everyday challenges of growing up. It encourages young children to pursue the challenging experiences that support their growth and development. It helps young children recognize that there are many ways to approach and learn from the challenging experiences in their lives and that to try and not succeed fully is a natural and valuable part of learning.

Based on the martial arts film star, Jackie Chan is an agent of a secret police organization who poses as an amateur archeologist. The undercover Jackie teams up with his 11-year-old niece, Jade, to travel the globe in search of magical talismans. He must collect these talismans before the sinister Dark Hand operatives get to them first. It's magic, mystery, and adventure as Jackie takes on new challenges every day.

Dragon Tales is designed to increase children's collection of strategies to deal with the everyday challenges of growing up. It encourages young children to pursue the challenging experiences that support their growth and development. It helps young children recognize that there are many ways to approach and learn from the challenging experiences in their lives and that to try and not succeed fully is a natural and valuable part of learning.
This program teaches children how to develop self-control, patience, kindness, and love. It teaches children how to be gentle and helpful, as well as how to respect others and how to make friends.

The Reppies educates children between the ages of six to twelve on valuable life lessons as it explores the decision making process of the important and sometimes difficult choices that children encounter.
Colby's Clubhouse educates and informs children between the ages of 6-12 about how to successfully deal with everday situations and challenges using the principles of the bible.

The host of this program teaches children to sing, fun exercises, the alphabet and how to use the library. The children also learn the importance of reading as well as principles of science, like electricity.

This program teaches children not to be too proud, the importance of being responsible, having a willing and obedient attitude, using good judgement, the meaning of real love, not taking revenge and how to have good friendships with others.
Circle Square educates and informs children between the ages of four and twelve by presenting Biblically based values and morals used for problem solving in everyday situations.
The Reppies educates children between the ages of 6 to 12 on valuable life lessons as it explores the decision making process of the important and sometimes difficult choices that children encounter.
Virtual Memory is a Bible trivia show that educates and informs children between the ages of thirteen and seventeen by affirming positive social skills through Biblical facts and principles.
Circle Square educates and informs children between the ages of four and twelve by presenting Biblically based values and morals used for problem solving in everyday situations.

Flying House educates and informs children between the ages of five and ten by teaching Bible stories that highlight the important character traits children will need in life such as courage, loyalty and responsibility.

Superbook educates and informs children between the ages of five and ten by teaching Bible stories that highlight the important ccharacter traits children need in life such as courage, loyalty and responsibility.
Joy Junction educates and informs children between the ages of eight and twelve by teaching Bible history and the development of social and moral values.
Gospel Bill educates and informs children between the ages of five and twelve by teaching positive social skills and self awareness based on Biblical principles.
Faithville educates and informs children between the ages of four and nine about the value of team work and the importance of the individual within the community.
Janice's Attic educates and informs children between the ages of four and eight about nature, personal health and the value of positive character qualities.
This program teaches children how to develop self-control, patience, kindness and love. It teaches children how to be gentle and helpful as well as how to respect others and how to make friends.

The Reppies program is an Emmy award winning 24-episode series dubbed "the coolest praise band" to hit the stage for God. It deals with problems kids encounter daily, such as peer pressure, drug use and family problems.

The Reppies program is an Emmy award winning 24-episode series dubbed "the coolest praise band" to hit the stage for God. It deals with problems kids encounter daily, such as peer pressure, drug use and family problems.

The host of this program teaches children to sing, fun exercises, the alphabet and how to use the library. The children also learn the importance of reading as well as principles of science, like electricity.

This program teaches children not to be too proud, the importance of being responsible, having a willing and obedient attitude, using good judgment, the meaning of real love, not taking revenge and how to have good friendships with others.
This program educates and informs children between the ages of 4-8 by presenting biblically based values and morals used for problem solving in everyday situations.

The Reppies program is an Emmy award winning 24-episode series dubbed "the coolest praise band" to hit the stage for God. It deals with problems kids encounter daily, such as peer pressure, drug use and family problems.
This program is a bible trivia show that educates and informs children between the ages of 13-16 by affirming positive social skills through biblical facts and principles.
This program educates and informs children between the ages of 4-8 by presenting biblically based values and morals used for problem solving in everyday situations
This program teaches children about things like dealing with anger, bitterness, alcoholism and stealing. It reinforces loving others, kindness, sharing, and protecting the faithful and innocent.
Superbook is an animation series that teaches history by presenting biblical figures and events. Children are taught forgiveness, love, and overcoming trials and adversity.

This program teaches children how to say and do the "right" things, how to develop good habits and how to break bad ones. It teaches patriotism, and perserverance, as well as how to make love a priority and to follow good role models.

The setting of this program is an old western town where Gospel Bill and the rest of the townspeople teach children life lessons. Their lessons are on respect, honesty, healthy living, how not to exact revenge, how to resist using bad language and keep a good attitude.

This program teaches children how to take responsibility for their actions. It teaches listening skills and how to avoid being deceived. It also teaches children how to set priorities, how not to jump to conclusions and the importance of following instructions.
This program teachs children the importance of maintaining good physical condition. It stresses personal qualities like perserverance and honesty. Lessons are usually taught by example and analogies.

This series follows the adventures of Oswald, an animated octopus, who experiences the world as would a preschool child. Living in the metropolis of Big City, Oswald, curious and intensely interested in how the world works, picks his way through the problems and predicaments he faces by sorting through the varying responses of his friends and coming to his own answer. The objectives of this series are to assist preschool children in adapting to the early developmental challenges of building friendships, learning news physical skills, and beginning to understand their own perspectives, as well as those of others. The program also focuses on teaching life-lessons relating to tolerance, civility, problem-solving and cooperation. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission’s rules.

In this series seven-year-old Dora and her monkey travel companion Boots invite the audience to join them each week on a journey in which they will have to overcome various obstacles to reach an end goal. The series uses a CD-ROM/on-line adventure game format to encourage a variety of problem-solving strategies. The objectives of this program are to assist children in developing their problem-solving skills, reinforce their emerging cognitive skills, and make computers more familiar to them by introducing and using the conventions and vocabulary of computer games. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

In this series, a young adult host - together with Blue, a puppy whose personality and actions mirror those of a preschooler - brings viewers a variety of games, themes and concepts that are based on an age-appropriate educational curriculum. The program follows a narrative format, in which the host elicits contributions from the viewer to answer questions and move the action forward. The program's objectives include encouraging preschoolers to actively explore the world around them, fostering their problem-solving skills and independent reasoning, and creating a foundation of confidence and optimism for future learning. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

This is an animated series based on children's books written by Bill Cosby that examines life through the eyes of a five-year-old boy eager to understand his world. Each episode contains two stories in which Little Bill is faced with a challenge or problem - whether emotional, social or physical - he must solve. The objectives of this series are to encourage children to value themselves and the love and support of their family, friends and community, and to help them develop their social skills and ethical values by dealing with the conflicts in their lives with fairness and creativity. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

Based on a series by Paulette Bourgeois and Brenda Clark, this program features the adventures of the turtle Franklin and his friends Bear, Snail, Rabbit and Goose. The objectives of the program are to present to young viewers age-appropriate moral dilemmas addressing issues such as the meaning of right and wrong, the purposes of rules and the consequences of following or not following them, and the values inherent in telling the truth, and to teach viewers important social values such as cooperation and compromise, fairness, responsibility, self-respect and respect for others. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

This series presents episodes centered around Bob, a friendly builder, and his talking machines, and follows their adventures as they work on a variety of construction projects. Bob’s machines have minds of their own, and act like a gang of lively children, exhibiting traits to which a young audience will relate. The objective of the program is to provide an opportunity for preschool children to explore and learn about issues such as fears, sharing, shyness, teamwork, self-esteem, and cooperation, which are critical to their early development. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission’s rules.

Gerbert captures the innocence of childhood. Created to teach and entertain, Gerbert encourages children to become comfortable with who they are today and to believe in who they can become tomorrow. Gerbert helps children explore their minds, hearts and feelings, as well as the world around them.

Imagineland is a magical world with a cast of irresistible characters that children of all nationalities and ages will fall in love with. The show is set in a countryside some children can only dream about. The sun shines, the air is clean and the values are pure.

Scholastic's The Magic School Bus has many educational and informational objectives. They are to motivate children's interest in science, introduce science ideas, inspire positive attitudes toward science and education and model age appropriate science problem solving behavior. Each of the episodes explores a different science topic through an animated journey aboard the magically transformed school bus to destinations such as the center of the earth, inside the human body, to outer space, to remote ecological environments and inside of a plant.

A significant purpose of "Life with Louie" is to educate and inform children between the ages of 8 and 11. The educational and informational objective of the program is to offer children the opportunity to explore issues and scenarios that are common to growing up, yet might be perplexing to children, such as how to cope with family and friends as part of this process. As children view this series, not only are they being entertained, they are learning valuable lessons. The program will contribute to meeting school standards for grades 3 to 6 in the category of Life Skills, in the areas of Thinking and Reasoning; Working with Others; and Self-Regulation.

This Week in Baseball highlights the pro-social on and off the field activities of MLB's leading players and coaches, working with the National Association for Sport and Physical Education (NASPE). This Week in Baseball seeks to provide today's youth with educational messages that can have an impact on development of positive lifestyle behaviors. The program portrays the positive outcomes that result from dedication, hard work, self-discipline, teamwork, practice and personal responsibilities. The program also relates the achievements and experiences of baseball players to potential achievement in life.

NFL Under the Helmet showcases the pro-social on and off the field activities of the NFL's leading players and coaches. Working with the National Association for Sports and Physical Education, the program (1) educates teens about dedication, hard work, team work, goal setting, and community service, (2) provides examples of responsible social and personal behavior, (3) demonstrates how to deal constructively with the differences among people, and (4) teaches the benefits of physical activity and fitness.

Scholastic's The Magic School Bus has many educational and informational objectives. They are to motivate children's interest in science, introduce science ideas, inspire positive attitudes toward science and education and model age appropriate science problem solving behavior. Each of the episodes explores a different science topic through an animated journey aboard the magically transformed school bus to destinations such as the center of the earth, inside the human body, to outer space, to remote ecological environments and inside of a plant.

The Pet Shop is educational, practical, and lively. It is part neighborly chat and part animal kingdom insight, and offers unique advice and helpful tips on anything from housebreaking a puppy to supplementing a lizard's diet. This is an intelligent and entertaining program that is fun; it also gives children answers and makes them think.

The Pet Shop is educational, practical, and lively. It is part neighborly chat and part animal kingdom insight, and offers unique advice and helpful tips on anything from housebreaking a puppy to supplementing a lizard's diet. This is an intelligent and entertaining program that is fun; it also gives children answers and makes them think.

Scope is of educational value and is presented in an engaging manner. The most valuable thing about this program is the potential to spark interest in, and further independent exploration of, the different topics that are presented. Sample topics include information on common toxins, Aurora borealis, new directions in piano making for improved sound quality, bats, robotics, insects, stroke prevention and treatment, and psychological training for race-car drivers.

Scope is of educational value and is presented in an engaging manner. The most valuable thing about this program is the potential to spark interest in, and further independent exploration of, the different topics that are presented. Sample topics include information on common toxins, Aurora borealis, new directions in piano making for improved sound quality, bats, robotics, insects, stroke prevention and treatment, and psychological training for race-car drivers.

All episodes of Disney's Recess are designed to educate and inform children who are between the ages of two and eleven years old. More specifically, the programs teach children about the fundamentals, morals and educational lessons of life. This is a collection of animated stories about six fourth-grade children who attend public school. These children are an ethnically and gender-diverse group. Their experiences at Third Street School deliver messages about problems common to middle childhood: conflicts with authority figures, school and family rules, issues of fairness, peer pressure and coping with disappointment. A number of episodes revolve around class bullies or "teacher's pets." Series episodes provide opportunities for parent/child discussions about values.

column7: La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries High Five Challenge
column16: This locally produced program recognizes the importance of academic excellence, encourages acquisition of knowledge, and rewards young people who demonstrate both intellectual prowess and the willingness to compete in an academic arena. In the past nine years, more than $350,000 in prizes and scholarships have been awarded to outstanding high school students. High schools from throughout Oregon and Washington compete on High Five. Each team consists of five to seven students. All teams also have a mimimum of one High Five coach, either a teacher, counselor or parent. There is no cost to the schools to participate. The format of the show is primarily academic. It serves as a great interactive academic tool for viewers. Each week 50 questions and answers are featured, five questions in each of 10 categories. The target audience is youngsters 13 to 17 years of age. The motto of High Five continues to be "Kids Working in Teams, Not Gangs". This season (effective 9/22/01),as in the past, efforts are being made to encourage parents to watch High Five with their children as a form of positive reinforcement.

Miracle Pets is a one (1) hour live-action program designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals doing heroic, extraordinary actions. Children learn positive role models, pro-social values and the importance of taking care of the pets in thier lives.

Miracle Pets is a one (1) hour live-action program designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals doing heroic, extraordinary actions. Children learn positive role models, pro-social values and the importance of taking care of the pets in thier lives.

Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals doing heroic, extraordinary actions. Children learn positive role models, pro-social values and the importance of taking care of the pets in thier lives.

Miracle Pets is a one (1) hour live-action program designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals doing heroic, extraordinary actions. Children learn positive role models, pro-social values and the importance of taking care of the pets in thier lives.

Just Deal is a half-hour live-action program, designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. The show focuses on the development of three teens who are uniquely different from one another, yet forge deep bonds of friendship through their shared interests and problems. As these three navigate their way through high school, they will deal with all the important issues of adolescence, modeling their problem-solving and decision-making for the teen audience. Topics include racial identity, understanding and accepting loss, facing failure, effective communication, conflict management, personal responsibility, service to others, trust and betrayal, academic achievement, life balance and tolerance

California Dreams is a half-hour live-action program designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. The show revolves around students at Pacific Coast High School and deals with such topics as relationships, positive self-image and outlook, leadership, service to others, fair play, acceptable behavior, reputation and consequences for one's actions. The audience will relate to the struggles and tribulations the students go through at home, at school and in their personal relationships

Miracle Pets is a one (1) hour live-action program designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals doing heroic, extraordinary actions. Children learn positive role models, pro-social values and the importance of taking care of the pets in thier lives.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: SUPERBOOK is an animated series that teaches history by portraying Biblical figures and events. Children are taught forgiveness, love, obedience to authority, and how to overcome trial and adversity.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: FLYING HOUSE is an animated series that teaches history by portraying Biblical events and characters as a couple of kids and a robot go back through time searching for their lost dog. In their encounters, they are taught how to deal with anger and bitterness; and that stealing is wrong. FLYING HOUSE reinforces loving others, kindness, sharing, and the protection of the faithful and innocent.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: The program is the same as program #1 (SUPERBOOK), but it is in the Spanish language for our Hispanic population.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: NANA PUDDIN' teaches children basic core values such as being kind to others, accepting others, honesty, and being a good role model. It is cleverly done using a variety of actors, singers, and a ventriloquist.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: Black Buffalo, who is a real American Indian, teaches kids good morals and values such as honesty, loving your neighbor, and obeying your parents from an Indian longhouse.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: A cute lion teaches sharing, forgiveness, values, honesty, and loving others.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: JUST KIDS teaches values, patience, helping others, good health, friendship, and nutrition through a variety of methods such as puppets, ventriloquism, a cooking corner, and on-location shoots.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: GERBERT is a lovable character that teaches appreciation of books, reading, fairness, friendship, and honesty.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: The setting of this program is an old Western town where GOSPEL BILL is sheriff. He, and the rest of the townspeople teach children life lessons including respect, honesty, a positive attitude, healthy living, how to deal with anger, how not to exact revenge, and how to resist using bad language.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: Through a number of well done segments, WORSHIP FOR KIDS teaches about love, patience, good behavior, obedience to authority, and kindness to others. It uses music, a zoo segment, and also teaches respect.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: Through a clubhouse approach, honesty, good behavior, manners, being a friend, and respect is taught.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: SUNSHINE FACTORY is a cleverly done program about a fix-it shop which teaches life lessons to kids including honesty, obedience, discipline, and good habits.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: JOY JUNCTION teaches children how to say and do the right things, to develop good habits, how to break bad habits, and how to make love a priority. It also teaches good role modeling, and patriotism.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: BECKY'S BARN is about a talking cow in a barn with human characters who interact with her teaching children good manners, the alphabet, numbers, diligence, and honesty.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: This is a hard-hitting discussion show hosted by Mike Romanowski who talks with teens about issues that confront teens including sex, drugs, alcohol, parents, and gangs.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: The Brentwood Kids singers use music to teach values such as good judgment, honesty, and purity.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: This program uses delightful cherub angels to teach values and morals.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: This program targets teens with positive messages about their life issues they face now such as sex, drugs, parents, and alcohol. It uses music videos.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: This program uses a lovable seal to teach safety.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: Host Rod Hembree teaches young people to be humble, responsible, have good attitudes, good judgement, what real love is, friendship, and good morals.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: This program is a hard-hitting youth-oriented program that targets youth with good morals, anti-drug messages, no alcohol, and abstinance messages.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: SOLID ROCK VDO uses music videos to teach honesty, morality and values to teens.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: EDGES targets teenagers with anti-drug/smoking/drinking/sex messages and urges good morals, values, and judgment.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: CAFE VIDEO uses music videos to target teens with positive lifelessons about respect, good judgment, morality, and clean living.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: This program uses delightful cherub angels to teach values and morals.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: This program uses music videos to teach good values, good attitude, good judgment and what real love is to teens.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: This program uses a lovable seal to teach safety.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: STUDIO 8:28 is hosted by former youth pastor Al Dennison, and is another hard-hitting youth-oriented program targeting drugs, morality, parents, right choices, colleges, and careers.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: GERBERT is a lovable character that teaches appreciation of books, reading, fairness, friendship, and honesty.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: KIDS LIKE YOU teaches cooking, educates, demonstrates good character traits like honesty, friendship, and obedience.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: JUST KIDS teaches patience, values, helping others, friendship, health & nutrition, and loving others through puppets, ventriloquism, a cooking corner, and on-location shoots.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: A cute lion teaches sharing, forgiveness, honesty, and loving others.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: NANA PUDDIN' teaches children values such as being kind to each other, accepting others, honesty, being a friend, and being a good role model. It uses ventriloquism, puppets, actors, and music.

column3: Family Net, Worship, Cornerstone & World Harvest
column16: The Brentwood Kids singers use music to teach values such as good judgment, honesty, and purity.

"CITY GUYS" was produced in consultation with an educational consultant, focusing on the learning process of teenagers about the realities of life, and that actions have consequences. The show follows the encounters and problem-solving of five teenagers, and the guiding hand of their understanding, but tough Principal, through eventful school years at a Manhattan high school. The cast is ethnically and financially diverse. In each episode the cast starts at one level of knowledge and understanding. By the end of the episode they have moved to another level of understanding and decision making skills. The message is always integral to the plot and present through out the episode.

Tama's weekly adventures consist of stories that encourage learning and acceptance. The program uses the premise of cats and dogs getting along as a way to reinforce tolerance and appreciation for the differences in people. Each story has a theme that serves as a strong foundation for kids, such as the discovering the power of cooperation through working together and that perseverance pays off. The importance of friendship is consistent throughout each episode. Tama and the gang's commitment to one another supports the strength and beauty of friendship.

"Kids Talk Sports" will guide teens with the knowledge and influence of an accomplished and successful adult in the world of sports. Important issues facing kids will be addressed, such as, competition, dedication, importance of education, value of physical fitness, cheating, violence, and drug abuse. This show will provide a model to inspire children to meet and overcome challenges in their own lives.

This half-hour program educates young viewers about animals, their habitats, development and behavior, as well as, promoting awareness of important environmental issues. It demonstrates compassion for all living creatures while providing information on medial rehabilitation treatment.
